revised_title: Spectroscopic Methods in Photosynthesis: Investigating Photosystem Stoichiometry and Chlorophyll Antenna Size
tldr: This article explores the use of spectroscopic methods to measure photosynthesis, focusing on photosystem stoichiometry and chlorophyll antenna size. The authors found that the ratio of photosystem II to photosystem I reaction centers varies among different photosynthetic organisms, and that the size of the chlorophyll antenna affects the efficiency of electron flow between the two photosystems.
